DataElement.preferredDefinition: The reason the treatment dose was modified.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the reason the treatment dose was modified.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the skin, relating to or practicing dermatology.: Toxicity; the degree to which something is poisonous.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the skin.
The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.: Available in place of something else.: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.
Available in place of something else.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Toxicity that impairs or damages the heart. This condition is often caused by the administration of a pharmaceutical agent that initiates a poisonous or toxic response in cardiac tissue.

Concepts.definition: Toxicity that impairs or damages the heart. This condition is often caused by the administration of a pharmaceutical agent that initiates a poisonous or toxic response in cardiac tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: alteration or modification.: A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin). Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight. BSA is often an important factor in dosing.

Concepts.definition: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin).  Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight.  BSA is often an important factor in dosing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The main information-processing organs of the nervous system, consisting of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.: Toxicity; the degree to which something is poisonous.

Concepts.definition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.
The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The absence of life or state of being dead.

Concepts.definition: The cessation of life.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The worsening of a disease over time

Concepts.definition: A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM definitions to reflect change in NCIt concept definition. mc 10/31/13

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.: A discrepancy between a computed, observed, or measured value or condition and the true, specified, or theoretically correct value or condition. (http://foldoc.doc.ic.ac.uk/foldoc/foldoc.cgi?error)

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
A discrepancy between a computed, observed, or measured value or condition and the true, specified, or theoretically correct value or condition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (GAS-tro-in-TES-tih-nul) GI.  Refers to the stomach and intestines.: Toxicity; the degree to which something is poisonous.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the stomach and intestines.
The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.: Toxicity; the degree to which something is poisonous.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.
The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Refers to the liver.: Disturbance, impairment or abnormality of function.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to, affecting, or associated with the liver.
Disturbance, impairment or abnormality of function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Altered reactivity to an antigen, which can result in pathologic reactions upon subsequent exposure to that particular antigen.

Concepts.definition: An immune response that occurs following exposure to an innocuous antigen, but that does not require the presence of preformed antibodies to the antigen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. -- 2003: Fever, also known as pyrexia, is the elevation of the body's temperature above the upper limit of normal, usually taken as 37.7 degrees C.  Most fevers are caused by infections and almost all infectious diseases cause fever. (Wikipedia)

Concepts.definition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.
Elevation of body temperature above normal due to inflammatory or immune responses.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Information regarding the subject is unknown or inaccessible at this time.

Concepts.definition: Information regarding the subject is unknown or inaccessible at this time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.: A means of finding a solution to a problem, or a means of finding agreement or harmony.: A protocol is a rule which guides how an activity should be performed; a set of formal rules used to specify the format of an exchange of data.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.
A means of finding a solution to a problem, or a means of finding agreement or harmony.
A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.: alteration or modification.

Concepts.definition: The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Expected or scheduled.: Modified; changed in form or character.: A protocol is a rule which guides how an activity should be performed; a set of formal rules used to specify the format of an exchange of data.

Concepts.definition: Expected or scheduled.
Modified; changed in form or character.
A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The peripheral nervous system or PNS, is part of the nervous system, and consists of the nerves and neurons that reside or extend outside the central nervous system. (from Wikipedia): Toxicity; the degree to which something is poisonous.

Concepts.definition: That part of the nervous system consisting of the nerves and neurons that reside or extend outside the central nervous system.
The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to the lungs.: Toxicity; the degree to which something is poisonous.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the lungs as the intended site of administration, where the pharmaceutical product is administered, usually by inhalation, for local action in the lower respiratory tract or for systemic action after absorption via the lower respiratory tract.
The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or pertaining to the kidney.: Toxicity; the degree to which something is poisonous.

Concepts.definition: Of or pertaining to the kidney.
The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A schedule is an ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.

Concepts.definition: An ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.: Occurring first in time or sequence; original. (American Heritage Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.
Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The act or process of making something ready; also a medication made ready for administration; also an anatomic or pathologic specimen made ready and preserved for study.: of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.: A getting back or regaining.

Concepts.definition: The act or process of making something ready.
of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
A getting back or regaining.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A condition in which there is an abnormally small number of platelets in the circulating blood.: Event; something that happens at a given place and time.

Concepts.definition: A laboratory test result indicating that there is an abnormally small number of platelets in the circulating blood.
Something that happens at a given place and time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Increased numbers of platelets in the peripheral blood. (Dorland, 27th ed)

Concepts.definition: A hematology test result that indicates the presence of higher than normal platelet counts in the peripheral blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Refers to the liver.: Toxicity; the degree to which something is poisonous.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to, affecting, or associated with the liver.
The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created new VD from CTEP VD.

DataElement.changeDescription: Created new CDE from existing CTEP CDE Public ID 967 and used a different VD.
